page.title: 13Children's games;Fauldhouse
page.content: completly round. Beds or peevers are another favourite.{Aeroplane}beds are played by drawing with chalk on the ground, a semicircle for the den , followed by two squares 1+2 above each other , 3+4 are drawn above these jutting out to the side like the wings of an aeroplane,5 is above these two,6+7 are drawn as wings and 8+9 are above each other. A flat stone or small tin box , weighted,are used.You stand on one leg and with the edge ofthe other foot you nudge the 'peever'from one box to the other in sequence.You cannot put your foot down until you reach the end. There are many other outdoor games such as tig and hide and go seek ,kick doors and run fast , etc. Indoor games are many such as cluedo ,ludo , snakes and ladders,chess,draughts.
